required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nutritional Study of Fish Oil in Skin Quality in Healthy Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Two-armed, Double-blinded Nutritional Study of Fish Oil on Skin Quality in Healthy Women

brief_summary.textblock: The skin acts as a barrier against the external environment and prevents water loss from the body. Aging is a natural process leading to changes in the skin and fish oil has been shown to prevent inflammation, hyperpigmentation and UV-damage. This pilot study will determine skin characteristics after intervention with north atlantic fish oil.

detailed_description.textblock: Women will be recruited to a placebo or fish oil group and be examined at pre- and post for skin quality parameters such as wrinkles, fine lines and trans-epithelial water loss.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Placebo controlled, double blind intervention study.
study_design_info.masking_description: Interventions are given as 1g bovine capsules of equal size, weight and appearance, and provided in identical bottles with a coded label.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine the change in skin quality of healthy women after supplementation with fish oil compared to corn oil
primary_outcome.description: Changes in quantitative analysis of facial inflammation, wrinkles and fine lines and skin texture will be performed using the VISIA Skin Analysis system. Measurements will be made at baseline and at end of supplementation period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the change in omega-3 index (%EPA and DHA in red blood cells) after daily intake of 4g of north atlantic fish oil compared to placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Fatty acid profiles will be measured from blood samples using the Omega-quant test

arm_group.description: 4x1g capsules containing containing broad spectrum marine oil from north atlantic fish

intervention.description: 1g capsules containing oil broad spectrum marine oil from north atlantic fish

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Healthy women in the age of 30-65
Able to follow the following dietary restriction for 4 months (4 weeks wash-out, 3 months intervention):
- Do not take omega-3 supplements
- do not take supplements containing vitamin A
- do not take supplements containing collagen
- try to avoid using skin products containing vitamin A
- do not undergo skin treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
Pregnancy or breast feeding known allergy to seafood skin treatment the last 6 months planned skin treatment during the study period
-

eligibility.gender_description: Participation is based on self-assessment of gender identity

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be presented as collective statistical data. Individual participant data may be shared on request, or if demanded by journals
